metadata.title: CVE-2021-23962 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Incorrect use of the '<RowCountChanged>' method could have led to a user-after-poison and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-23962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
